result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse ML Foss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo AODA assessment and any other counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Management.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Absolute sobriety at all times.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:14 AM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse ML Foss in court.  Attorney Adam Kerner in court for Jesse ML Foss.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 2:
WI State Prison for 2 years (1 year Initial Confinement/1 year Extended Supervision)  Consecutive
Submit to DNA Sample
Undergo any counseling per agent to include Anger Management
AODA & treatment
Absolute Sobriety
No possession of controlled substances without valid Rx
$518.00 Costs & Supervision Fees
$197.00 Restitution plus 15% surcharge
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court.

2:48 PM Defendant Jesse ML Foss in court.  Attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Kerner in court for Jesse ML Foss.  State states joint recommendation of 1 yr IC/1 yr ES, consecutive, $518 costs, DNA, Restitution of $197, AODA, Absolute sobriety, Anger management assessment, No possession of a controlled substance without a valid Rx.  SAP/CIP eligible.  Atty Kerner agrees.  Atty Kerner does not believe there is any jail credit.  State agrees.  NCP entered, advised of const. rights, plea accepted by Ct.  Ct. finds Def. guilty.  Count 2: Dismissed but read in.  Chapter 950 has been complied with.  Atty Kerner requests sentencing be set out.  State does not object.  Atty Kerner requests a couple weeks out for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse ML Foss not in court.  Attorney Adam Kerner in court for Jesse ML Foss.  Atty. states told DE court was at 1:30.  1:47 PM DE here now.  Atty. Kerner states just reached agreement.  Reset for plea/sentencing.
No contact w/A.D.K. or her residence or any building that she occupies

03:30 PM Defendant Jesse ML Foss in court with attorney Adam Kerner.  Defendant Jesse ML Foss in custody.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State objects to the bond modifcation.  Atty Kerner advises an application was submitted for DE to enter the Sauk Co. Treatment Court.  Atty Kerner advises matter was set out due to not receiving discovery in all cases at the last hearing.  Court denies the request to modify the bond.  Any previous conditions of bond remain.
Motion hearing on April 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:06 PM Defendant Jesse ML Foss in court with attorney Adam Kerner.  Defendant Jesse ML Foss in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kerner requests another return date in 4 to 6 weeks.  He hasn't reviewed all discovery yet as he just received some.  Atty Kerner addresses the bond motion filed last week.  State has not reviewed the bond motion.  State does not object to another return date and there is a global offer.  Matter reset.  Atty Kerner to get a bond hearing from Br. 2 JA.  Return date scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
to Modify Bond

records.addlTxt: 01:10 PM Defendant Jesse ML Foss in court with attorney Adam Kerner.  Defendant Jesse ML Foss in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on February 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:13 AM Defendant Jesse ML Foss in court with attorney Adam Kerner.  Defendant Jesse ML Foss in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE waives preliminary hearing freely, voluntarily and knowingly.  Enough facts in complaint to bind over.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.   Requests arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on January 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:00 AM Defendant Jesse ML Foss in court.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin as well as Deputy Breunig - SCSD.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes this was reset so DE could have counsel but the DE has not waived his time limits for the prelim.  DE did have counsel on 1/13/22 but that counsel has withdrawn and the PD's office hasn't had time to appoint new counsel.  Court advises DE of his choices for today's hearing - either proceed w/o counsel or waive time limits to allow the Court to reset so counsel can be appointed.  DE does not wish to waive his time limits.  Court questions DE on counsel.  DE doesn't waive his right to counsel.  Court again finds good cause for continuing the prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
to Br. 3 from Atty Gumz requesting new counsel
Preliminary hearing on January 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:43 AM Defendant Jesse ML Foss in court, in custody.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin along w/Court Officer Alex Breunig.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes results from hearing earlier this morning.  State reached out to PD's office and they were told that they couldn't have new counsel present in time for this reset PH either today or tomorrow but they would reappoint.  Court questions DE on his wish to have his PH today and that he would like an attorney to assist him.  DE agrees.  Court makes good cause finding noting DE wants counsel but PD's office is unable to reappoint this fast, that time limits will need to be extended.  PH reset.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 13, 2022 at 11:45 am.

10:08 AM Defendant Jesse ML Foss in court with attorney Saralinda R Watts appearing by phone.  Defendant Jesse ML Foss in custody.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Watts states status noting she's not ready to proceed as she is ill.  Court advises DE of his right to prelim and time limits.  DE does not wish to waive his time limits.  Atty Watts motions to withdraw then as she doesn't feel she can represent him adequately.  Court grants that motion and Atty Watts is free to leave this hearing.  Court will adjourn this prelim to 11:45 a.m. and they will reach out to PD's office to see if they can get someone appointed by 11:45 a.m.  Time limits expire tomorrow.  State concurs and will reach out to the PD's office right away.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Cover Letter from Atty. Watts
and Motion for Time to File Additional Pretrial Motions

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on January 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:09 PM Defendant Jesse ML Foss in court with attorney Allison A Markoski.  Defendant Jesse ML Foss in custody.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesse ML Foss appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE asks to speak to counsel again.  Court mutes the audio.  Back on the record, DE is advised of rights to an attorney.  State makes bail argument requesting cash and no contact provision.  Atty Markoski responds requesting a signature bond.  Time limits not waived for preliminary hearing.  $500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/A.D.K. or her residence or any building that she occupies.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
